website_summaries.verdict: Cleans most surfaces and with a jolt of power that may surprise based on the price point.
pros: Clean with ease at speeds up to 160 mph
cons: Does not come with a cord

customer_reviews.title: Just super.. I use it to blow leaves etc
customer_reviews.text: Just super .. I use it to blow leaves etc. out of my garage and all the nooks and crannies where they hide. Really surprised and pleased with the power. What used to take an hour plus with brooms now takes minutes. And when I was looking for blowers this (quality made) was inexpensive.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Weinstein

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful and Easy to Use.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item in early Spring as I have a neighbor with a tree that doesn't shed all of its leaves until mid-December. It's always a daunting task to rake them all up even in a relatively small brownstone backyard. A friend suggested a blower, I needed something lightweight and easy, this was the choice. It was so helpful in getting between the nooks behind the grill, AC condenser and behind the bushes. It was quiet and simple to operate. Couldn't be happier, in fact, I just ordered one for my 90 year young Mother.
customer_reviews.author: T. Merele Williams

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price!
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking for something to blow all of the leaves in your yard, this blower is NOT for you. However, this little guy is perfect for sweeping off lawn clippings and leaves off patios, sidewalk, and driveways. It is what it is. Don't expect it to blow down a house at this price point. It's perfect for little jobs, and I couldn't be happier with it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Invest your money elsewhere
customer_reviews.text: I used this blower 3 times for a total of 5 minutes. Tried to unplug extension cord from blower and it broke (see picture). I'd give it zero stars if possible. Of course this happened just outside of return date. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Hough

customer_reviews.title: you have yourself a nice lightweight blower
customer_reviews.text: For the price this lil puppy does the job. It does NOT come with a cord so you provide your own, and once you figure out how to notch it though the intended slot to notch it, you have yourself a nice lightweight blower. Being a woman I find this to be just perfect, not Too Heavy.
customer_reviews.author: K.D.

customer_reviews.title: Finally kicked the bucket
customer_reviews.text: I started having problems months after buying this blower. Sometimes it would turn on sometimes it would just stop working. I think the problem was with the switch, I would have to press hard on the switch while using it to keep it from turning off. It did last 2 years but with it turning off randomly I would not recommend this blower. Original review: This blower is weak compared to the blower I replaced that had the same size motor. It takes twice as long to get the job done now.
customer_reviews.author: IB

customer_reviews.title: Deafening.
customer_reviews.text: The reviewers who said this is noisy were correct. It is deafening. My hearing was affected by using it for about a minute. I can wear earplugs but my neighbors in my apartment complex can't escape the noise as I blow leaves off my small enclosed patio. I logged on to return it on what the website is telling me is the last day for a return, September 21, but the system is not allowing me to return it. A good price doesn't make a good deal if the item is a bad fit, and a website that disregards its own rules about returns is cheating its customers.
customer_reviews.author: D L in Los Angeles

customer_reviews.title: Love using it!
customer_reviews.text: I am a senior female. This is very powerful for what I need. Looks good. good price...BUT very noisy. I won't be using it that much so I am very satisfied. Using just to blow leaves off porch (drops constantly in the fall) and blow garage floor (0ccasionally) and to blow patio (occasionally). Gardener blows weekly but sometimes leaves drop hourly/daily. I'd recommend! Power cord not included.
customer_reviews.author: golflover2001

customer_reviews.title: Can’t get a refund on defective product
customer_reviews.text: This product did not work, despite trying multiple new power cords. I want my money back but company refuses to refund. Will be careful with Amazon in the future advise all others to do likewise.
customer_reviews.author: VIKI

customer_reviews.title: Functions but...
customer_reviews.text: Very light weight. I thought, with the wind speed close to that of a strong tornado, that it would blow stronger than it does. Don't wear loose clothing because it gets sucked to the blower. Other than that, it functions, it's inexpensive and it is light.
customer_reviews.author: Pauline

customer_reviews.title: I have a small lawn so it's ok but it's annoying to keep having to stop and put it back ...
customer_reviews.text: Nozzle where air comes out pops off constantly. I have a small lawn so it's ok but it's annoying to keep having to stop and put it back on.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pass On This One
customer_reviews.text: Started out great for a about 5 minutes, then worked intermittently for about 10, then quit and now won't start. However, it did work well for the short period it was going.
customer_reviews.author: Dallis Hensley

customer_reviews.title: Handheld F5 Tornado
customer_reviews.text: It's hard to explain how hard this thing blows. I am able to blow out my entire two car garage in less than 10 seconds. I have been using a battery powered cordless blower for the past few years from a major manufacturer. I thought I liked that blower until I discovered what this blower can do. The Greenworks 24012 blows no less than twice as hard as my battery powered blower. It's also much lighter; granted the cord can be a pain in the butt. The blower is a steal at this price. I will certainly try more Greenworks products.
customer_reviews.author: Kdig14

customer_reviews.title: CAN NOT RETURN AND NO POWER
customer_reviews.text: I read reviews saying this item it great. But it is not. It took me almost 2 hours to blow the leaves from my small yard because there is just no power. The description is false in the power. And to top it off YOU CAN NOT RETURN THIS ITEM!!!!! Anything to rip off the consumer. Guess I should have bought it from a local store and I would have been able to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Safety Hazzard
customer_reviews.text: For the price, it does a great job. As for safety, you may want to re-consider purchasing this. I don't know why they design in a way you need to plugin power cord directly into the blower. The extension cord keeps coming off so often that you get frustration. On top of that, yesterday while blowing a leaves, the connection area started to smoke and melt. I do not recommend this product due to poor design and safety issue.
customer_reviews.author: Hiro Morikawa

customer_reviews.title: piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in August but waited a couple weeks before using it. It came on for about a minute and then died. Amazon will not refund but is telling me to contact manufacturer for replacement parts. That's ridiculous for an item at this price. Follow up: Amazon was very responsive and sent me a replacement quickly. But guess what? EXACT SAME THING HAPPENED, blower came on but after about 15 seconds stopped working. DO NOT BUY THIS! And Amazon should not be recommending this item!
customer_reviews.author: Suzie Seagull

customer_reviews.title: Economical for casual residential use
customer_reviews.text: This blower works ideally for causal residential use. Not recommended for professional or heavy use. It has enough power to blow large masses, but fine blades especially on glass will remain. For $27 at the time of this review, this blower is economical but don’t expect long range or detail work. It’s corded electric which was ideal for me. If you need to go further than an extension cord you don’t have or won’t buy, than consider a battery or gas operated blower. Construction is solid. About 120 mph jet air - you will need to lift objects for trapped adjacent grass.
customer_reviews.author: General

customer_reviews.title: It worked for no more than 3 minutes.
customer_reviews.text: Was very excited for this and happy it came on Sunday. Immediately unboxed, connected to heavy duty 25ft extension cord and turned on. It worked for no more than 3 minutes. Turned off to move car and when I went to switch it back on it made a tick-tick sound, had a bad smell and then nothing. I tried other outlets, checked breakers and varified outlet power. Apparently Its broken.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny

customer_reviews.title: a strong blower.
customer_reviews.text: This was much more powerful than I expected. It blew dead leaves form 12 feet away and dozens of Daddy Long Leg Spiders that decided to take over my porch went a flying far, far away. Just put the nozzle on, plug in and go to town. I am quite satisfied. BTW -- It does have the cord loop thingie on back so the plug doesn't pull out.
customer_reviews.author: D. L. Cillo

customer_reviews.title: Won't turn on after 3 months
customer_reviews.text: Worked for about 3+ months while being used every ten days for driveway and patio cleaning after mowing/edging. After those 3 months, the device decided it no longer loved me and just stopped waking up for work. Pass on this one. She'll just break your 💓.
customer_reviews.author: Brad the Tech Wizard

customer_reviews.title: Packs a lot of power
customer_reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised by how much air this unit can move for how small and light it is. And it is quite light, not to mention very well balanced. It's a pleasure to use. It's able to even blow gravel around, which helps immensely when you have to clean up matter interspersed in yard rock. If you have trouble keeping it plugged it, note that there are protrusions to loop a bit of cord through to hold it and provide strain relief. I'll say, I like the color, too. For the price, I'm extremely pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Tom B.

customer_reviews.title: Does what the broom can't...
customer_reviews.text: Our home is in a pine forest in northern California. The wind and squirrels scatter 12-inch long pine needles and sharp pine cone bits all over the deck. They weave their way into the outdoor carpet, and get stuck between the deck slats. Even a stiff-bristle broom can't dislodge these pokey little hazards to bare feet. Received the blower today, in perfect condition, snapped it together in seconds, plugged it in (you have to supply your own 2-prong extension cord) and had a very large deck cleared in minutes... Including the rug. Powerful, easy to use, effective, and a great value!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend this Powerhouse
customer_reviews.text: WOW! This thing packs a lot of punch for the price! I just wanted it to clear grass clippings and leaves but it actually can force dirt and other caked on debris from sidewalks, driveways etc. I have a stone walkway and was able to blow back the dirt around the edges - I wasn't even trying to do that. I am highly impressed. The fact that it is electric is a pain, and make sure you have the correct gauge-sized extension cord for your space because I DID burn out my greenworks trimmer by using the wrong gauge ext cord. :( Lesson learned. I love this thing.
customer_reviews.author: dhasselhoff

customer_reviews.title: Powerful and Light Weight
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this as a part of our new lawn care equipment. We are leaving gas powered machines alone now because the gas in our garage is too much of a hazard to store safely. I am in LOVE with this blower! I always had trouble getting the gas powered one to work. With this, I just plug it in and am done before I would have ever gotten the other one going! I have a 100' cord that I use so I had no trouble clearing every bit of my drive and patio at all. If you need a lightweight blower this is the one to get. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Penny Butterworth

customer_reviews.title: spend your money on something more powerful
customer_reviews.text: i get a lot of pine needles. after buying i found out about the no return policy even though amazon SUPPOSEDLY backs everything. on my first use which was just a quicky, didn't seem very powerful. put it through the ringer the other day. would say it 95% useless for my needs or anyone else's. good for minor debris situations, useless for most situations. had to go over five times what would normally take one sweep
customer_reviews.author: JJM

customer_reviews.title: Excellent bang for the buck
customer_reviews.text: This a great light duty blower. It's perfect for cleaning garages, sheds, driveways, walkways and blowing leaves. I even use it to blow away the fallen petals from a pink flowering tree. It did great on the petals on the ground but not quite as well with the petals caught in the branches of the evergreen shrubs below. It's very easy to operate and the cord holder ensures that you're not plugging the cord back in every few minutes. Overall, I'm very happy with it, especially at this price point. It's a little loud, so although not necessarily mandatory, hearing protection is advised.
customer_reviews.author: Kimo

customer_reviews.title: Throw away the outdoor broom.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic! A broom costs almost $10. This wind broom is a 100x faster than the push one. What a relief for the sidewalk, driveway and deck! Life gets easier.
customer_reviews.author: tried

customer_reviews.title: Compact and Powerful
customer_reviews.text: Bought this because of it's small size. Have to store it in a small compartment in travel trailer. I use it to blow off leaves and debris on top of trailer slide outs. It works GREAT ! Blew the dust and dirt out of a 4 car garage in seconds. It is a little noisy because it is high speed only. We have a larger Toro leaf blower ( $80), variable speed and slightly more powerful, but this smaller one will definitely get the job done at one third the price !
customer_reviews.author: Romans

customer_reviews.title: Great Product, No Longevity.
customer_reviews.text: I have used it about 4 times. I used it for blowing grass/dirt/water off the side work, car porch, & steps. The only problem I have, is the button don't hold the nozzle on the blower. I have to tape the nozzle to the blworking. .. I've had this product for 10 month. Today, it stopped working. This is the second I brought. No more Green works product for me. It appears, it has no longevity.
customer_reviews.author: Juniboy

customer_reviews.title: Just what we needed!
customer_reviews.text: We live on the ground level in a large apartment complex where many people on the second and third level have bird feeders hanging from their balconies. So all the sunflower seed shells and other seed fall down on our patio and makes a big mess! I saw this and thought the price was very good and other reviews were positive. My husband used it for the first time today and it cleaned all the seed, bird feathers and other dirt off with ease. We have two small rugs out there too and the blower cleaned those as well. Very good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Hardly any power, I had to put the blower 2-3" away from the leaves to make them move slightly.
customer_reviews.author: CA9949Fox

customer_reviews.title: I'd hate to try to blow New England leaves with this ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to blow the dirt and sand out of my garage as well as blow the water off my car after washing. I give it 5 stars for cleaning my garage. I give it 3.5 stars for blowing the water off my car. I certainly helped but I wish I spent more money for a higher volume blower to dry my car. It was certainly worth the money for my use. I'd hate to try to blow New England leaves with this in the fall. I doubt it would work on an average yard. (Untested)
customer_reviews.author: DadK

customer_reviews.title: ... weight and we don't have to worry about maintenance like a gas powered one
customer_reviews.text: Extremely light weight and we don't have to worry about maintenance like a gas powered one. We use this to clear debris & leaves from our driveway and deck because both of them sit under two huge trees. Works great but I am unable to say how it performs on grass. Some reviews state that the fastener for the cord doesn't really work, which I agree with. However I don't really think it's that big of a deal... Just hold the cord like you would on a vacuum cleaner. Would recommend having a really long extension cord if your driveway is as big as mine. Makes it a lot easier to maneuver around.
customer_reviews.author: michelle1234

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: Love it...great packaging, easy open and no excess packing. It is so lightweight, as an older person I can use it with ease. No more aching arms and back. I can easily use one handed and it feels like nothing.And it blows hard enough to clean up trash and stuff that falls on the yard and patio. Have not had chance yet top use for leaves, but will try it out this fall. I have struggled with my old blower for years; what a difference this makes. I think I need to look at the weed eater next!
customer_reviews.author: pat

customer_reviews.title: Game Changer
customer_reviews.text: I have a Greenworks mower and I have been very happy with it. This blower is a life saver. I have never owned one before so my commentary on having a blower in place of a rake is a game changer. I live in AZ and we all have gravel in our yards and a blower gets the leaves and leaves the gravel. The nozzle was a great idea because it creates this wall of air instead of a column of air. Light, not too loud, and I couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: JediShopper

customer_reviews.title: Works great until it doesn’t
customer_reviews.text: Was wowed by the price. Blower worked great for a year and a half, then melted/fused to the extension cord plug. I ruined both attempting to unplug it. Cannot give high marks to a product that fails in a dangerous way.
customer_reviews.author: Matt M

customer_reviews.title: Buy headpiece over ears to lessen noise and for more comfort
customer_reviews.text: Had more uses than I expected-I used it to blow leaves and debris off 2nd floor porch rather than tedious sweeping them up several times a year- dreaded this chore-we have a lot of trees- gardener collected them at his next visit-I also used it to clean out garage of debris,dirt and leaves-did much better job than sweeping,easier and faster-used to sweep back and front porches and steps and also INDOORS!-blew out dust from areas previously unable to reach(ex. under treadmill-)Powerful and makes jobs so much easier-should also buy headpiece-noise without bearable but so much more pleasant with one-also for outdoors- use when has been dry for at least a day-wet debris more difficult to blow off
customer_reviews.author: anonymous

product_meta.title: Greenworks 24012 7 Amp Single Speed Electric 160 MPH Blower
product_meta.description:
Size:7 AmpShop for Leaf Blowers from ReelMowerSource.com! Clean up any mess that Mother Nature may have left behind with the Greenworks 24012 Single Speed Electric Blower. This lightweight corded blower plugs in and uses a 7-amp motor which means no harmful emissions. It can reach speeds of 160 mph to collect grass clippings and leaves in piles. The blower tube comes in two pieces and measures 20 inches long. A 4-year manufacturer's warranty is provided. Weight: 4.58 lbs.About GreenWorksAll GreenWorks products have a carbon footprint of ZERO. That means that absolutely no emissions are ever released and you'll never have to inhale gas fumes while mowing your yard or trimming your hedges. Plus it means higher efficiency so you'll get more out of your lawn tools each time you use them. Each product is EnergyStar-approved by the Environmental Protection Agency which means that energy usage is reduced by about 35 percent. For GreenWorks Green is more than just a name - it's a commitment.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
The GreenWorks products that you purchase have a ZERO carbon footprint. We'll say that again - our entire product line will never release an ounce of carbon emission into the air. 4 Year Warranty - Double The Industry Standard. When looking for lawn tools, we know you're thinking about quality. You're looking for something that will get the job done and get you back to your weekend. That's why GreenWorks backs every tool with a full four-year warranty - we know our products will perform at the highest level and always be reliable. GreenWorks high quality products are manufactured to last. That's why we back every product with a warranty that's twice the industry standard. We'll provide all the power you need without polluting the air or forcing you to keep hauling your gas can to the nearest station (especially in the middle of a mow). No more tune-ups or maintenance. No more emissions. Fifty-four million Americans mow their lawns every weekend, according to the EPA, using 800 million gallons of gas each year. Along the way, homeowners spill more than 17 million gallons of gas while refueling. That's equivalent to the 1989 Exxon Valdez disaster. It's time to move beyond clumsy, harmful gas-powered mowers. It's time for GreenWorks to be your lawn tools for life.
feature_bullets: 160 MPH wind speeds for helping remove debris and dust from hard surfaces
Lightweight design for better handling and less user fatigue
Virtually no vibration when compared to gas blowers
Convenient cord lock to prevent accidental unnplugging
Extension cord is not included. Refer to pg. 9 in Owner's Manual for proper extension cord selection

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars3,999 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
